bibl.title: Harry Gong vs. United States. Criminal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: United States District Court, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF OREGON Washington Northern Division
In the Matter of the Application of YUT YOW Harry Gong for a Writ of Habeas Corpus for Yut Yow

Upon reading and filing the petition of Yut Yow, duly signed and verified by the said Yut Yow, whereby it appears that the said Yut Yow is illegally imprisoned and restrained by R. P. Bonham, Acting United States Chinese Inspector in Charge, at the City of Portland, County of Multnomah, State and District of Oregon, which petition sets forth wherein the alleged illegality consists, from which it appears to me that a Writ of Habeas Corpus should issue therein.

It is ORDERED that def R P Bonham Writ of Habeas Corpus show cause why & should not issue out of and under the seal of the District Court of the United States of the District of Oregon Washington, Northern Division, directed to the said R. P. Bonham, Acting United States Chinese Inspector John H. Sargeant, Asst Commissioner in Charge at Portland, Oregon Seattle, Wash, commanding him, the said R. P. Bonham John H. Sargeant, to produce the body of the said Yut Yow before me in the court room of the above entitled court on the 17th day of January, 1914, at 10 o'clock A. M. of said date, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Yut Yow, and to certify and return therewith the time and cause of said imprisonment or restraint, and that he have then and there the said Writ, and by motion of District Attorney

p.del: It is further ordered that said Yut Yow be and she is hereby admitted to bail in the sum of $5000.00 until further order of this court.

div1.p: Dated at Portland, Oregon Seattle, Wash, this 13th day of January, 1914.
div1.ab: (SS) R S Bean Jeremiah Neterer Judge.
